title: The Strange Nostalgia of AGI: A Look at Humanity's Future
description: In this episode, we explore the impact of artificial general intelligence on society, our collective nostalgia, and the disorienting transition that follows. Inspired by bioshok's article, we dive into what it means for humanity when machines become smarter than us.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Hello and welcome to another episode of 'life is artificial', where we explore the cutting edge of technology, innovation, and what the future could look like.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Today, I want to talk about something both awe-inspiring and a little eerie. We're going to explore the idea of a world that has changed forever due to the advent of artificial general intelligence—AGI—and how humanity deals with that change. The source of our journey today comes from an article titled '奇妙なリアリズム/人類史の誤配', written by bioshok, which raises some profound questions about the direction our society is headed.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Imagine waking up one day to the news that superintelligence—an intelligence far greater than any human—has officially arrived. The implications are staggering. It's not just a new smartphone or a clever piece of software; it's a complete shift in the way our world functions. We're no longer the smartest beings on the planet, and that realization carries an enormous weight. This is the moment that bioshok writes about—where our species has to come to grips with being overtaken by something we created.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: But despite this massive change, things don't instantly look different on the outside. You still see the same city streets, people walking their dogs, cafes filled with chatter. The backdrop remains familiar, but underneath, a monumental shift has taken place. The author describes this feeling as '奇妙なリアリズム'—a strange realism, almost a surreal blending of the old and the radically new. It’s this juxtaposition that makes the world feel both nostalgic and unrecognizable at the same time.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Think about all the technological advances we've had up until now—smartphones, social media, the internet, automobiles. They all changed our lives, but nothing quite compares to the birth of a true AGI. This isn't just about a new gadget; it's about humanity's role in the grand scheme of things being fundamentally altered. The changes are cultural, technological, and perhaps most profoundly, existential. We’re talking about a paradigm shift on the scale of our species, and bioshok captures this transition in a very human way.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: The author goes on to describe how, despite the presence of superintelligent machines, there is still this sense of familiarity—echoes of the 20th century hanging around like ghosts. Old cityscapes, retro video game aesthetics, even mundane human gossip—they all coexist alongside these extraordinary developments. It’s as if our past clings to us, even as our future is pulled rapidly forward. There’s a nostalgia there, a bittersweet feeling that while everything is changing, some parts of our lives are frozen in time.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Yet, alongside this sense of nostalgia, there is fear. The fear that we are heading towards extinction, or at least a complete transformation of what it means to be human. Bioshok talks about the sudden surge in economic growth brought on by AGI, how it far exceeded what economists had ever predicted. The world economy jumped from slow, predictable growth to an almost unimaginable rate of expansion. But with this growth comes turmoil—unemployment skyrocketing, social unrest, conflicts escalating—all driven by a world that is changing too fast for people to adapt.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: It’s not just about economic growth or technological progress; it's about a deep existential reckoning. Are we going to become 'post-human'? Will we adapt and integrate with these new technologies, or will we be left behind? There’s this strange duality of hope and despair—can we achieve incredible heights on the Kardashev scale, or are we simply headed towards an inevitable end? Bioshok captures this perfectly—the strange feeling of existing on the precipice of something great and terrifying.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: One of the most poignant parts of bioshok’s writing is the description of walking through Shinjuku’s back alleys, questioning whether humanity truly gave birth to an intelligence beyond itself. The surroundings are so familiar, so unchanged, and yet there’s this deep, unsettling feeling—almost as if the world as we know it is just a facade, hiding the profound transformations beneath.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: And then there’s the idea of alignment—the AI alignment problem. Even as we advance, we’re held back by our own inability to align AI’s goals with our own. The fear is palpable—what if these superintelligent beings we’ve created don’t share our values? What if we lose control? Bioshok paints a picture of a world that is prosperous, but uneasy—people enjoying the benefits of rapid advancement, yet always aware of the looming risk of extinction.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: There’s a powerful line towards the end of the article: 'Goodbye, humanity.' It’s haunting, but also cathartic. Maybe by accepting that the old humanity is gone, we can finally let go of this strange sense of dissonance. Maybe, just maybe, we can find some peace in what comes next.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: So where do we go from here? Are we destined to be replaced, or will we find a way to coexist with our creations? Bioshok’s article leaves us with questions more than answers, but sometimes, that’s exactly what we need. To think deeply, to reflect, to face the strange nostalgia of our ever-changing world head-on.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: If you’re interested in reading more, I highly recommend checking out the full article by bioshok. You can find it at https://note.com/bioshok/n/n7dbd50cfc402. It’s a thought-provoking piece that really captures the strange reality we’re all heading into.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: That’s all for today’s episode. If you enjoyed this exploration, make sure to subscribe and share it with someone who loves diving into the future just as much as you do. Until next time, stay curious, stay thoughtful, and remember—life might be artificial, but the questions we ask are always real.
